translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise in the Abhidhamma Piṭaka

original: 17.21. Vedanāttika, Kusalattika🔽Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Sukhāya🔽vedanāya sampayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto
analyzed: vedanā attika kusala attika  sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam kusalam dhammam paṭicca na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam kusalam dhamma  paṭicca na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sukhāya  vedanāya sampayuttam kusalam dhammam paṭicca na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Feeling, the Chapter on the Wholesome

original: nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto nakusalo ca naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽nakusalo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam kusalam dhamma 🔽paṭicca na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na kusalaḥ ca na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ 🔽na kusalaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam kusalam dhamma
translated: A wholesome phenomenon associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as a root-cause condition, for a wholesome phenomenon not associated with pleasant feeling. A wholesome phenomenon associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as a root-cause condition, for a wholesome phenomenon not associated with painful feeling. A wholesome phenomenon associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as a root-cause condition, for a wholesome phenomenon not associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling. A wholesome phenomenon associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as a root-cause condition, for a wholesome phenomenon not associated with pleasant feeling and for a wholesome phenomenon not associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling. A wholesome phenomenon associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as a root-cause condition, for a wholesome phenomenon not associated with painful feeling and for a wholesome phenomenon not associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: paṭicca nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto nakusalo ca naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽nakusalo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: paṭicca na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na kusalaḥ ca na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  na kusalaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam kusalam dhamma

original: Adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

original: Hetuyā cuddasa, adhipatiyā cuddasa …pe… avigate cuddasa.🔽Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta.🔽Dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta.🔽Adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta. (Ekavīsati pañhā.)
analyzed: hetuyā cuddasa adhipatiyā cuddasa pe avigate cuddasa  sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā satta  dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā satta  adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā satta ekavīsati pañhā
translated: With respect to cause there are fourteen, with respect to predominance there are fourteen … with respect to non-disappearance there are fourteen.🔽From a wholesome object that is associated with the pleasant feeling there is no arising of an unwholesome object that is associated with the unpleasant feeling, by way of root-cause condition … there are seven.🔽From an unwholesome object that is associated with the unpleasant feeling there is no arising of an unwholesome object that is associated with the unpleasant feeling, by way of root-cause condition … there are seven.🔽From an unwholesome object that is associated with the neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling there is no arising of an unwholesome object that is associated with the neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, by way of root-cause condition … there are seven. (Twenty-one questions.)🔽🔽

original: Hetuyā adhipatiyā ekavīsati …pe… avigate ekavīsati.🔽Sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto abyākato dhammo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa naabyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

original: Ārammaṇe ekavīsati, adhipatiyā dasa, anantare cha …pe… upanissaye ekavīsati, natthiyā
analyzed: ārammaṇe ekavīsati adhipatiyā dasa anantare cha pe upanissaye ekavīsati natthiyā
translated: In the clause “With respect to object there are twenty-one” there are twenty-one kinds of object for the unprofitable consciousnesses.🔽In the clause “With respect to condition there are ten” there are ten conditions for the unprofitable consciousnesses.🔽In the clause “With respect to absence there are six” there are six kinds of absence for the unprofitable consciousnesses.

original: vigate cha. (Dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaabyākatamūlaṁ adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayuttaabyākatamūlampi kātabbaṁ.)
analyzed: vigate cha dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutta abyākata mūlam adukkham asukhāya vedanāya 🔽sampayutta abyākata mūlam pi
translated: In the clause “With respect to dissociation there are six” there are six kinds of dissociation for the unprofitable consciousnesses.
